comments.creator: alundil@hotmail.com
comments.author: alundil@hotmail.com
comments.text:
User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; rv:7.0.1) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/7.0.1
Build ID: 20110928134238

Steps to reproduce:

Navigated to corporate Juniper SSL login page (https).
Enter login credentials.



Actual results:

Received a new Juniper update installation file that needed to be installed.
Installed the new Juniper Network Connect files (ver. 7.0.0.17289).
Received a error "You are not allowed to sign in."
Redirected back to logon page.


Expected results:

Juniper JAVA client should have launched and begun the VPN session.

I confirmed that it is not related to my account credentials as I successfully logged in with IE9 (yuck).

This was working flawlessly with the same version of Firefox (ver. 7.0.1) as little as a week ago.

User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; rv:7.0.1) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/7.0.1
Build ID: 20110928134238

Steps to reproduce:

Navigated to corporate Juniper SSL login page (https).
Enter login credentials.



Actual results:

Received a new Juniper update installation file that needed to be installed.
Installed the new Juniper Network Connect files (ver. 7.0.0.17289).
Received a error "You are not allowed to sign in."
Redirected back to logon page.


Expected results:

Juniper JAVA client should have launched and begun the VPN session.

I confirmed that it is not related to my account credentials as I successfully logged in with IE9 (yuck).

This was working flawlessly with the same version of Firefox (ver. 7.0.1) as little as a week ago.
